## ðŸŽ“ 24-25 Students Performance Analysis

Based on the data from the 2024-2025 academic year, here's a comprehensive analysis of student performance:

### Overall Statistics

```{r performance-analysis-24-25, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

              "Shuwen Guan", "Andrea Guarna Vetro", "Chuaner Huang", "Alibek Kurmangaliyev",

# Remove students with no grades
students_with_grades <- students_24_25 %>% 
  filter(!is.na(final_grade))

# Calculate summary statistics
summary_stats <- students_with_grades %>%
  summarise(
    n_students = n(),
    mean_grade = round(mean(final_grade, na.rm = TRUE), 2),
    median_grade = round(median(final_grade, na.rm = TRUE), 2),
    sd_grade = round(sd(final_grade, na.rm = TRUE), 2),
    min_grade = min(final_grade, na.rm = TRUE),
    max_grade = max(final_grade, na.rm = TRUE),
    pass_rate = round(sum(final_grade >= 18, na.rm = TRUE) / n() * 100, 1)
  )

# Display summary table
kable(summary_stats, 
      col.names = c("Students", "Mean Grade", "Median Grade", "Std Dev", "Min Grade", "Max Grade", "Pass Rate (%)"),

```

### Grade Distribution

```{r grade-distribution, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Create grade distribution plot
ggplot(students_with_grades, aes(x = final_grade)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 2, fill = "steelblue", alpha = 0.7, color = "black") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = mean(students_with_grades$final_grade), 
             color = "red", linetype = "dashed", size = 1) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 18, color = "green", linetype = "dashed", size = 1) +
  labs(title = "Grade Distribution - Academic Year 2024-2025",
       x = "Final Grade (out of 30)",
       y = "Number of Students",
       caption = "Red line: Mean grade | Green line: Passing threshold (18)") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
```

### Intermediate Exam Performance

```{r intermediate-analysis, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Analyze intermediate exam performance
intermediate_stats <- students_24_25 %>%
  filter(!is.na(first_intermediate) | !is.na(second_intermediate)) %>%
  summarise(
    first_intermediate_mean = round(mean(first_intermediate, na.rm = TRUE), 2),
    second_intermediate_mean = round(mean(second_intermediate, na.rm = TRUE), 2),
    first_intermediate_n = sum(!is.na(first_intermediate)),
    second_intermediate_n = sum(!is.na(second_intermediate))
  )

kable(intermediate_stats,
      col.names = c("1st Intermediate Mean", "2nd Intermediate Mean", "1st Intermediate Count", "2nd Intermediate Count"),
      caption = "Intermediate Exam Performance")
```

### Performance by Exam Type

```{r exam-type-analysis, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Create comparison plot
exam_comparison <- students_24_25 %>%
  select(first_intermediate, second_intermediate) %>%
  pivot_longer(everything(), names_to = "exam_type", values_to = "grade") %>%
  filter(!is.na(grade)) %>%
  mutate(exam_type = ifelse(exam_type == "first_intermediate", "1st Intermediate", "2nd Intermediate"))

ggplot(exam_comparison, aes(x = exam_type, y = grade, fill = exam_type)) +
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.7) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2, alpha = 0.5) +
  labs(title = "Performance Comparison: Intermediate Exams",
       x = "Exam Type",
       y = "Grade",
       fill = "Exam Type") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        legend.position = "none")
```

### Key Insights

1. **Overall Performance**: The mean final grade for the 2024-2025 academic year was `r summary_stats$mean_grade` out of 30.

2. **Pass Rate**: `r summary_stats$pass_rate`% of students achieved a passing grade (â‰¥18).

3. **Grade Range**: Final grades ranged from `r summary_stats$min_grade` to `r summary_stats$max_grade`.

4. **Intermediate Exams**: Students performed similarly on both intermediate exams, with slight variations.

5. **Distribution**: The grade distribution shows a normal distribution with most students scoring in the middle range.
